p: The fragility of cancer patients is well known, with many cases affecting aged patients or those with several comorbidities that frequently results in a loss of independency and functionality. Based on these patients characteristics and the data coming from Protezione Civile indicating that around 20% of cancer deaths from COVID infection occurs in patients with previous cancer or active of cancer ( 1), a number of actions in the hospitals have been set up to maintain cancer patients out of hospitals when there is no urgent need. It has been recommended that, when possible, the follow up visits for cancer patients treated with oral anticancer drugs are performed telematically. Furthermore, many patients refuse hospital visits, even if necessary, because of fear of contagion: in some Italian regions the first non-urgent visits have been postponed with the consequent delay in diagnosis which will affect disease prognosis.
